meanings.definition: The quality of being capable of being demonstrated.
meanings.sent1: Her demonstrability in the science fair project impressed the judges.
meanings.sent2: The demonstrability of the math theorem made it easy for the students to understand.
meanings.sent3: The cat's demonstrability in catching the toy mouse was quite entertaining.
meanings.sent4: His demonstrability in solving puzzles was like watching a master magician at work.
meanings.sent5: The demonstrability of the experiment's results left no room for doubt.

meanings.definition: The ability to be shown or proven.
meanings.sent1: The demonstrability of the evidence convinced the jury of his innocence.
meanings.sent2: In science class, we learned about the demonstrability of chemical reactions.
meanings.sent3: The puppy's demonstrability in learning new tricks was both adorable and impressive.
meanings.sent4: The demonstrability of her talent on the piano was like listening to a musical genius.
meanings.sent5: The demonstrability of the theory was evident in the practical experiments conducted.
